summary: The Medical Supply Chain Resiliency Act aims to improve the United States' medical supply chain resilience by authorizing the President to enter into trade agreements with "trusted trade partners" for the reciprocal elimination of duties on medical goods. The bill's goals include diversifying supply chains, enhancing supply chain security, removing trade barriers, and fostering international collaboration.  It outlines congressional oversight procedures and monitoring of agreements to ensure compliance, ultimately striving to strengthen national security and public health.
